title: What the papers say – February 5
description: The Daily Mail echoes the pleas from the mother of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey, who said her daughter would still be alive if children were better protected from the internet. MAIL: Brianna’s mum: limit phones for under 16’s #TomorrowsPapersToday pic.twitter.com/5pv6ae7biE

title: Former Scottish Labour leader Kezia Dugdale admits voting SNP
description: A former leader of the Labour Party in Scotland has admitted voting SNP. Kezia Dugdale told a new BBC documentary she was "so mad about Brexit" she backed the party at the European Parliament election in 2019. She said she had voted Labour at every election since.

title: Foreign Office minister in Abu Dhabi for talks on ‘desperate’ Gaza situation
description: “The UK remains firmly committed to working with our key partners, like the UAE, to secure an immediate pause in fighting, make progress towards a sustainable ceasefire, and build momentum towards a long-term political solution to the crisis.” Hamas ...

title: Funds to help schools install subsidised car chargers and sell energy to drivers
description: The Department for Transport said it will provide up to 75 of the cost to install chargers, up to a maximum of £2,500 per socket.

title: Chemists develop method to take ‘chemical fingerprint’ from gin samples
description: A gin still at the Isle of Harris distillery (Andrew Milligan/PA) Dr McIntosh said: “Gin production has exploded in Scotland and the UK over the past 20 years, but compared to Scotch whisky it’s very loosely defined and regulated, and not well researched.

title: Abuse of councillors and staff putting democracy at risk, say local government groups
description: When you consent to data collection on AMP pages you are consenting to allow us to display personalised ads that are relevant to you when you are outside of the UK. Read more about ... good councillors out of local politics altogether," said Councillor ...

title: UK defence: If the public wants the UK to remain powerful, voters should demand the nation can credibly defend itself against threats
description: A damning report by MPs lays bare how much the country's warfighting readiness is in doubt. Sky's Deborah Haynes says it's about choice and whether the UK should retain its legacy position as a powerful country with nuclear weapons and capable armed forces.

title: Leading GOP conservative faces political storm over border bill
description: Sen. James Lankford (R-Okla.) is in the middle of a political storm as he tries to pull off the Herculean task of passing the Senate’s bipartisan border package into law amid rising opposition. Lankford and his fellow Senate negotiators have been taking ...

title: NI politics: What issues are in new ministers' in-trays?
description: Stormont has a new set of ministers - parties selected the departments they wanted during the assembly's first sitting on Saturday. Sinn Féin, the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP), Alliance and Ulster Unionist Party (UUP) were all entitled to posts, while the justice minister was elected by a cross-community vote in the assembly.

title: DUP deal aimed at restoring power sharing in Northern Ireland is published
description: On Tuesday, the UK and EU Joint reached agreement to make changes to that ... But beyond the practicalities, it's the political consequences that loom large. The government is now embarking on a hard sell of the plan alongside the DUP leader, after those ...

title: Threat of Russia, Iran and China using Ireland as 'back-door' to UK, report warns
description: Researchers warn an expansion of Russian, Chinese and Iranian presences in the Republic of Ireland 'signals the intent to infiltrate, and interfere in, the transatlantic community'

title: Political parties must commit to apprenticeship levy reform, says BRC
description: The British Retail Consortium (BRC) warned that a reform of the apprenticeship levy is "vital" for the future growth of the economy and has called on the UK's political parties to commit to this in their manifestos ahead of the general election.

title: Foreign Office minister in Abu Dhabi for talks on ‘desperate’ Gaza situation
description: A Foreign Office minister will travel to the United Arab Emirates to continue talks with partners in the Middle East about establishing a “sustainable ceasefire” in the war between Israel and Hamas. Lord Ahmad of Wimbledon will return to the region on Monday to continue British engagement over the conflict, the Foreign Office said.

title: Spend Local scheme generated £154m of ‘additional output’ for north’s economy, says report
description: An independent report into the 2021 Spend Local scheme in Northern Ireland, which offered £100 cash cards to every adult, has concluded that just over half the £137m spent by the public was used to pay for goods and services the holder would have purchased anyway.

title: UK companies facing second-highest level of financial ‘distress’ in Europe
description: UK businesses are facing the second-highest level of “deepening” financial distress in Europe due to inflation and high interest rates. The Weil European Distress Index has shown failing profitability as the main driver for business distress across the continent.

title: Lucky Saint cheers sales jump after bumper December
description: The UK’s largest dedicated alcohol-free beer brand has revealed a festive sales surge as it said shoppers have found “new occasions” to have a pint. The boss of Lucky Saint said it traded “particularly well” over December, as many drinkers have moderated their alcohol consumption throughout the year and not only for Dry January.

title: New Executive calls for urgent discussions on funding for public services
description: Northern Ireland’s newly formed Executive has written to Prime Minister Rishi Sunak calling for urgent discussions on long-term funding stability to deliver public services.

title: Chemists develop method to take ‘chemical fingerprint’ from gin samples
description: Chemists have trialled a new technique that takes a “chemical fingerprint” of gin in seconds, which could help producers futureproof their gins and conduct quality control.

title: Chris Mason: NI power-sharing affords Rishi Sunak chance for a victory lap
description: BBC political editor Chris Mason looks ahead to Rishi Sunak's trip to Belfast as Northern Ireland's executive returns.

title: 'The West has been censored like Mao's China', claims exiled Chinese artist after his exhibition was cancelled over social media post on Israel-Gaza conflict
description: Exiled Chinese artist (left) told Trevor Phillips (inset, left) that 'society becomes so timid, to really avoid any kind of questioning or argument' after he had a show cancelled in London in November.

title: Britain should bolster its military presence in Northern Ireland to stop it being used by hostile states as a 'back door' to attack the UK, report warns
description: In a study backed by former Tory and Labour defence secretaries, the Policy Exchange think tank warns that Ireland's defences could leave this country vulnerable to attack.

title: Warning over Ireland’s threat to UK as Sunak visit Ulster
description: Ireland would be “no friend” to the UK under Sinn Fein, a report backed by two former defence secretaries warned as Rishi Sunak visited Northern Ireland to mark the restoration of power to Stormont.

title: ‘We now have the opportunity, means and responsibility to deliver a better future for all the people of NI’
description: Yes, the challenges ahead are significant. But with the Assembly and Executive back up and running, with new powers and more funding, we now have the opportunity, the means and the responsibility to deliver that vision of a better future for all the people of Northern Ireland. The time for talking is over. Now it’s time for the real work to begin.

title: US says strikes on Iran-linked militias just ‘the beginning’ of its response
description: National security adviser refuses to rule out targeting Iran after 85 sites were attacked in Iraq and Syria

title: Iranian officials linked to 'malicious' cyberattacks targeting critical US infrastructure
description: The US Treasury Department’s Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) imposed sanctions on six officials who were linked to cyber attacks against US infrastructure at home and abroad

title: Top minister refuses to rule out Irish unification vote within a decade
description: A TOP Cabinet minister refused to rule out a vote on Irish unification within a decade. Northern Ireland’s new Sinn Fein First Minister Michelle O’Neill said she expects a vote to take place in

title: Nigel Farage ‘open-minded’ about joining Tories after next election
description: Former Ukip leader hints at move as he prepares to attend launch event for Liz Truss’s Popular Conservatives group next week

title: Rishi Sunak to meet with Northern Irish leaders at Stormont after power-sharing restored
description: Following changes to the agreement between the UK and EU, the Democratic Unionist Party dropped its opposition to an executive being formed in Northern Ireland, paving the way for power-sharing to restart.

title: Tory members threaten to vote Reform unless one of these three people replaces Rishi Sunak
description: EXCLUSIVE: A major survey of registered Conservative members when Rishi Sunak became leader suggests party activists will go on strike at the general election.

title: The Times Health Commission’s 10 recommendations to save the NHS
description: Patient passports, faster mental health treatment for the young and writing off student loans for doctors who stay within the health service are among proposals from our experts

title: The green future cannot be at the expense of jobs and national defence
description: The green future cannot be at the expense of jobs and national defence. Labour has earmarked £3bn of investment from our spending plans to secure the industry's long-term future. We have a plan to build a better Britain, and we want to build it with steel made in the UK. We need our steel.

title: US strikes Iran-backed groups as Israel-Hamas war rages
description: Mohammed Al Bukhaiti, a top member of the Houthi Political Council, said the group will continue its military operations until the siege on Gaza is lifted and vowed to respond to the latest US and UK strikes in Yemen. In the group's first reaction to the ...

title: My own experience of misogyny and bullying in showbiz
description: It didn’t exactly come as a shock but I was saddened to hear that the singer and former X-Factor finalist Rebecca Ferguson had such a tough

title: Time for Stormont to deliver for people in Northern Ireland – Sunak
description: Stormont’s focus should be now be on “delivering for families and businesses across Northern Ireland”, after powersharing was restored, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has said.

title: How Facebook’s Like button powered today’s internet
description: The impact of the Like button has also been tied to significant political moments, too. Facebook's algorithms were used to impact general elections in the Philippines in 2015, in the UK's Brexit vote and the US Presidential election in 2016. In 2014 ...
